turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Luas cyberattack.
turn.1: What happened in the Luas cyberattack?
turn.2: Luas cyberattack In January 2019 the website for the Luas was compromised with a message threatening to "publish all data and send emails to your users" unless 1 Bitcoin was paid in five days.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: At the time of the attack one bitcoin was worth €3,385.
turn.6: Transdev took the site offline on Thursday January 3 2019.
turn.7: What else did you find interesting?
turn.8: That afternoon they said that the records affected were those of people who had signed up to a Luas newsletter and that those people would be contacted in the next 24 hours to inform them of the breach.
turn.10: No financial records had been compromised.
turn.11: Did they take any other actions?
turn.12: The Data Protection Commissioner and Garda National Economic Crime Bureau were both notified of the attack.
